messages.content: You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV(blue line) and OP(orange line) on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. The typical feature of Stiction is that the change of PV lags behind that of OP.
<image>This is PV&OP-t graph. Is there stiction?
No, there is no stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
PV does not lag behind OP, does not meet the characteristics of stiction.

You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV on the y-axis and OP on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. The typical feature of Stiction is loop trajectory
<image>This is PV-OP graph. Is there stiction?
No, there is no stiction in this sysytem.
Why, how do you judge?
This graph have no hysteresis loop.

You need to judge whether there is Stiction by the image. The image has PV(blue line) and OP(orange line) on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. PV stands for process variable and OP stands for controller output. The typical feature of Stiction is that the change of PV lags behind that of OP.
<image>This is PV&OP-t graph. Is there stiction?
No, there is no stiction in this control loop.
Why, how do you judge?
PV and OP change in opposite directions, does not meet the characteristics of stiction.
